ack.title: Acknowledgements
ack.p: This work was undertaken as a part of the CGIAR Research Program on Policies, Institutions, and Markets (PIM) led by the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI). Funding support for this study was provided by the CGIAR Research Program on Dryland Cereals (DC), CGIAR Research Program on Policies, Institutions, and Markets, Global Futures Project funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (grant no. is OPP1009468), and USAID-ICRISAT Linkage Project.
The first author is grateful to Drs. Peter Craufurd and Van Oostrom for providing the old data sets of ICRISAT on pearl millet for this study.
The opinions expressed here belong to the authors, and do not necessarily reflect those of PIM, DC, IFPRI, ICRISAT or CGIAR.
